meals.name: Anything But Basic Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Anything But Basic Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line a muffin tin with 10 muffin cups and spray with oil-based spray.
2. Combine wet ingredients - In a large bowl, combine sugar, eggs, melted butter, buttermilk, and vanilla extract.
3. Mix dry ingredients - In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt.
4. Fold together - Fold dry ingredients into wet mixture, stirring only until combined. Having a few lumps in the batter is totally fine!
5. Fill and bake - Scoop batter into prepared muffin cups, filling just shy of the top. Bake 5 minutes at 425°F, then lower oven to 350°F without opening the door and bake 15 additional minutes.
6. Cool - Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/anything-but-basic-muffin-recipe/)

meals.name: Fluffy Chocolate Chip Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Fluffy Chocolate Chip Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Prepare 10 standard muffin tins with liners.
2. Combine wet ingredients - In a large bowl, combine melted butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time, then incorporate Greek yogurt, buttermilk, and vanilla extract.
3. Add dry ingredients and chips - Add flour, baking powder, and salt, mixing until just starting to combine. Fold in chocolate chips until just combined. Batter will be thick.
4. Fill tins - Scoop batter into prepared tins (about 3/4 full). Sprinkle tops with sugar if desired.
5. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 additional minutes until golden brown.
6. Cool - Cool for at least 15 minutes before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/fluffy-chocolate-chip-muffins/)

meals.name: The Best Blueberry Muffins EVER
meals.instructions:
## The Best Blueberry Muffins EVER

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Grease 10 standard muffin tins and line with cupcake liners.
2. Combine sugar and butter - Combine granulated sugar and melted butter in a large mixing bowl, whisking until combined.
3. Add wet ingredients - Add eggs one at a time. Mix in Greek yogurt, milk, and vanilla extract.
4. Add dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, and salt. Fold batter together with a silicone spatula until mostly combined—do not overmix. Toss blueberries in remaining 2 tablespoons flour, then fold into batter.
5. Fill tins - Scoop batter into prepared muffin tins, filling about 3/4 full. Sprinkle tops with turbinado sugar if desired.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce oven to 375°F and bake an additional 15 minutes until golden brown.
7. Cool - Cool for at least 15 minutes before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/the-best-blueberry-muffins-ever/)

meals.name: Pumpkin Streusel Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Pumpkin Streusel Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 375°F - Line 12 muffin cups with liners and spray with cooking spray.
2. Combine wet ingredients - Combine pumpkin puree, sugars, vegetable oil, milk, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl; mix well.
3. Add dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, and salt.
4. Mix together - Stir dry ingredients into wet mixture until combined.
5. Fill muffin cups - Distribute batter into prepared muffin cups, filling about two-thirds full.
6. Make streusel - Mix streusel ingredients (butter, flour, brown sugar, salt, pecans) until texture resembles wet sand. Divide evenly among the 12 muffins.
7. Bake - Bake 15-17 minutes until a knife inserted in center comes out mostly clean. Cool slightly.
8. Make glaze - Combine all glaze ingredients (powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, salt) in a small bowl. Drizzle over cooled muffins and serve.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/pumpkin-streusel-muffins/)

meals.name: Blueberry Streusel Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Blueberry Streusel Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Prepare 10 standard muffin tins with liners.
2. Make streusel - Combine streusel ingredients (butter, sugar, flour) using a fork until texture resembles wet sand.
3. Combine wet ingredients - Mix melted butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time, then yogurt, buttermilk, and vanilla.
4. Add dry ingredients - Fold in flour, baking powder, and salt until barely combined. Toss blueberries with 2 tablespoons flour, then fold into batter.
5. Fill muffin cups - Fill muffin cups 3/4 full using a large scoop.
6. Add streusel - Top each with approximately 2 tablespoons streusel, pressing gently.
7. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F for 15 additional minutes until golden and springy.
8. Cool - Cool at least 15 minutes before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/blueberry-streusel-muffins/)

meals.name: Coffee Cake Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Coffee Cake Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Grease and line 10 muffin tins with cupcake liners.
2. Combine wet ingredients - Combine melted butter and granulated sugar. Add eggs one at a time, then incorporate sour cream, buttermilk, and vanilla extract.
3. Add dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, and salt; mix until partially combined.
4. Make cinnamon swirl - In a separate bowl, combine cinnamon sugar swirl ingredients (brown sugar, cinnamon, salt).
5. Make crumb topping - In another bowl, mix dry crumb topping ingredients (brown sugar, flour, cinnamon), then add melted butter until clumpy.
6. Layer batter - Fill muffin cups halfway with batter. Add a spoonful of cinnamon mixture, then top with remaining batter (about 3/4 full).
7. Add crumb topping - Crown each muffin with crumb topping, pressing gently.
8. Bake - Bake 5 minutes at 425°F, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 additional minutes until golden.
9. Make glaze - Cool 15 minutes. Mix glaze ingredients (powdered sugar, vanilla, salt, milk) and drizzle over cooled muffins.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/coffee-cake-muffins/)

meals.name: Chocolate Chunk Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Chocolate Chunk Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line 9 muffin tins with muffin cups.
2. Cream butter and sugar - Using a standing mixer with paddle attachment, cream butter and sugar on high until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Beat in egg for one minute, then add Greek yogurt and vanilla until combined.
3. Mix dry ingredients - In a small bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
4. Combine - Incorporate dry ingredients into wet ingredients until partially combined (not fully incorporated). Fold chocolate chunks into batter until combined. Batter will be thick.
5. Fill tins - Scoop batter into muffin tins, filling just below the liner tops. Sprinkle granulated sugar on top.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce oven to 375°F and bake an additional 15 minutes until golden brown and muffins spring back when touched.
7. Cool - Cool for at least 5 minutes before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/chocolate-chunk-muffins-recipe/)

meals.name: Blueberry Banana Cornbread Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Blueberry Banana Cornbread Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line a muffin tin with 12 cupcake liners.
2. Mash bananas - Mash ripe bananas in a large bowl. Add eggs and coconut oil; mix well.
3. Add remaining wet ingredients - Incorporate Greek yogurt, sugar, and vanilla extract, whisking to combine.
4. Mix dry ingredients - In a separate bowl, mix baking soda, corn flour, gluten-free flour, and salt. Fold dry ingredients into wet mixture until combined.
5. Add blueberries - Fold in blueberries.
6. Fill cups - Divide batter evenly among 12 cups using a large cookie scoop or 1/4-cup measure.
7. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes. Reduce heat to 375°F and bake 10-12 additional minutes until muffins spring back when touched.
8. Cool - Cool before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/blueberry-banana-cornbread-muffins/)

meals.name: Lemon Blueberry Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Lemon Blueberry Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Grease 10 muffin tins and line with cupcake liners.
2. Combine sugar and lemon zest - Combine sugar and lemon zest in a large bowl. Rub together with your fingers until fragrant. Add melted butter and beat until combined.
3. Add wet ingredients - Add eggs one at a time, then blend in Greek yogurt, milk, lemon juice, vanilla extract, and lemon extract. Mix thoroughly.
4. Add dry ingredients - Fold in flour, baking powder, and salt until mostly combined—avoid overmixing. Gently fold in blueberries.
5. Fill tins - Distribute batter among prepared tins (about 3/4 full). Sprinkle with turbinado sugar if desired.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 minutes more until golden and springy.
7. Cool - Cool at least 15 minutes before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/lemon-blueberry-muffins/)

meals.name: Bakery Style Blueberry Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Bakery Style Blueberry Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Grease 8 large muffin tins and set aside.
2. Cream butter and sugar - Using a standing mixer with paddle attachment, cream butter and sugar on high for about 3 minutes until light and fluffy. Beat in egg for one minute, then incorporate Greek yogurt and vanilla extract until combined.
3. Mix dry ingredients - In a small bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Reserve 2 tablespoons of dry mixture.
4. Combine - Add remaining flour blend to wet ingredients, mixing gently until partially combined. Toss blueberries with reserved flour, then fold into batter until just combined (batter will be thick).
5. Fill tins - Fill prepared muffin tins to the top. Sprinkle with turbinado sugar if desired.
6. Bake - Bake 5 minutes at 425°F, reduce heat to 375°F, and bake 15 additional minutes until golden brown and springy.
7. Cool - Cool at least 15 minutes before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/bakery-style-blueberry-muffins/)

meals.name: Healthy Blueberry Bran Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Healthy Blueberry Bran Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 350°F - Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
2. Toast wheat bran - Toast wheat bran on a baking sheet for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally; let cool.
3. Prepare raisins - Heat raisins with water, simmer 10 minutes until water absorbs, then puree until smooth.
4. Mix dry ingredients - Mix toasted bran, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
5. Combine wet ingredients - Separately combine raisin puree, buttermilk, orange zest, maple syrup, coconut oil, and eggs.
6. Combine wet and dry - Combine wet and dry ingredients until just combined, fold in blueberries.
7. Fill tins - Spoon 1/4 cup batter into each muffin tin, rounding the tops slightly.
8. Bake - Bake 25-30 minutes until muffins feel set in center.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/blueberry-bran-breakfast-muffins/)

meals.name: Apple Crisp Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Apple Crisp Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 350°F - Line 12 muffin cups with liners.
2. Prepare apple - Peel and grate one medium apple using a large-holed grater.
3. Mix muffin batter - Combine brown sugar, eggs, oil, and vanilla in a bowl. Fold in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, then fold in grated apples.
4. Make crisp topping - Mix crumble ingredients (brown sugar, flour, oatmeal, cinnamon, nutmeg, butter) separately. Use a pastry cutter to work butter through until the mixture resembles coarse sand.
5. Assemble - Distribute batter evenly among 12 muffin cups and top with crumble mixture.
6. Bake - Bake for 20-25 minutes, then cool slightly before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/apple-crisp-muffins/)

meals.name: Apple Crumble Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Apple Crumble Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Prepare 12 muffin cups with liners.
2. Make streusel - Combine streusel ingredients (butter, sugars, flour) using a fork or pastry cutter until the mixture resembles wet sand.
3. Mix wet ingredients - Mix melted butter and sugars together. Add eggs one at a time, then Greek yogurt, milk, and vanilla.
4. Add dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, spices, and salt; mix until partially combined. Fold in apple pieces.
5. Fill muffin cups - Fill muffin cups three-quarters full using a large cookie scoop or 1/4 cup measure.
6. Add streusel - Top each muffin with approximately 1 tablespoon streusel, pressing gently into batter.
7. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 additional minutes until golden.
8. Make glaze - While baking, combine glaze ingredients (powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, salt) if desired.
9. Cool and glaze - Cool completely before drizzling with icing.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/apple-crumble-muffins/)

meals.name: Apple Carrot Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Apple Carrot Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line a muffin tin with 10 cups and spray with oil-based spray.
2. Combine wet ingredients - Combine brown sugar, eggs, melted butter, buttermilk, and vanilla in a large bowl.
3. Add mix-ins - Stir in apples, carrots, and coconut until blended.
4. Mix dry ingredients - In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Combine - Fold dry ingredients into wet mixture until just combined—lumps are acceptable.
6. Make streusel - Combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt; cut in butter with a fork until resembling wet sand.
7. Fill and top - Fill muffin cups nearly to the top; sprinkle with streusel.
8. Bake - Bake 5 minutes at 425°F, then reduce to 350°F and bake 15 additional minutes (don't open oven door).
9. Cool - Cool 10 minutes in tin, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/apple-carrot-muffins/)

meals.name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line 12 muffin cups with liners and spray with cooking spray.
2. Mix wet ingredients - Combine pumpkin puree, sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl.
3. Mix dry ingredients - In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, and salt.
4. Combine - Fold dry ingredients into wet mixture until combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
5. Fill cups - Fill muffin cups just over two-thirds full. Sprinkle with finishing sugar if desired.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 additional minutes.
7. Cool - Cool slightly before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/pumpkin-chocolate-chip-muffins/)

meals.name: Homemade Raisin Bran Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Homemade Raisin Bran Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 350°F - Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
2. Toast wheat bran - Toast wheat bran on a baking sheet for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool completely.
3. Prepare raisins - Heat 1 cup raisins with 1/2 cup water, simmer 10 minutes until absorbed. Puree until smooth.
4. Combine wet ingredients - Combine toasted bran, buttermilk/yogurt, 1 cup water, raisin puree, orange zest, and brown sugar in a large bowl. Stir in oil and eggs.
5. Add dry ingredients - Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Sift into wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in remaining 1/2 cup raisins.
6. Fill tins - Spoon batter into muffin tins, mounding slightly.
7. Bake - Bake 25-30 minutes until centers feel set.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/not-your-grandmas-bran-muffins/)

meals.name: Morning Glory Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Morning Glory Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line 24 muffin cups with liners and grease the tin tops.
2. Mix wet ingredients - Whisk together oil, brown sugar, and eggs. Fold in carrots, apples, vanilla, and orange juice.
3. Add dry ingredients - Add flours, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and spices to wet ingredients. Mix gently without overmixing.
4. Add mix-ins - Fold in raisins and coconut.
5. Fill cups - Scoop 1/3 cup batter into each muffin cup.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F for 12 additional minutes until springy and a knife inserted comes out mostly clean.
7. Cool - Cool before serving.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/the-best-morning-glory-muffins/)

meals.name: Healthy Peanut Butter Banana Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Healthy Peanut Butter Banana Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line a muffin tin with 12 cups and spray with oil-based spray. Set aside.
2. Mix wet ingredients - In a large bowl, combine bananas, peanut butter, honey, eggs, and vanilla. Stir until well mixed.
3. Add dry ingredients - Add oat flour, baking powder, and salt; fold to combine.
4. Add chocolate chips - Add chocolate chips and avoid overmixing.
5. Fill cups - Scoop batter into prepared cups, filling just below the rim.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then—without opening the oven—reduce temperature to 350°F and bake 15 additional minutes.
7. Cool - Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/healthy-peanut-butter-banana-muffins/)

meals.name: Pumpkin Carrot Cake Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Pumpkin Carrot Cake Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Line 12 muffin cups with cupcake liners.
2. Mix wet ingredients - Mix carrots, pumpkin, coconut, raisins, sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl.
3. Combine dry ingredients - Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt in a separate bowl.
4. Combine - Fold dry ingredients into wet mixture until just combined.
5. Fill cups - Divide batter evenly among 12 muffin tins using a 1/3 cup measure or large ice cream scoop.
6. Bake - Bake at 425°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 minutes more until a knife inserted in the center comes out mostly clean.
7. Make glaze - Cool muffins slightly. While cooling, whisk together all glaze ingredients (maple syrup, milk, powdered sugar, salt, vanilla) until smooth.
8. Glaze - Drizzle glaze over warm muffins and serve.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/pumpkin-carrot-cake-muffins/)

meals.name: Carrot Cake Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Carrot Cake Muffins

1. Preheat oven to 425°F - Grease 12 muffin tins and line with cupcake liners.
2. Combine wet ingredients - Combine oil, brown sugar, eggs, yogurt, milk, vanilla, carrots, and coconut in a large bowl; whisk until combined.
3. Add dry ingredients - Add flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon to wet ingredients; whisk until just combined. Fold in raisins if using.
4. Fill tins - Fill muffin tins about 3/4 full using a large cookie scoop or 1/4 cup measure.
5. Bake - Bake 5 minutes at 425°F, then reduce to 375°F and bake 15 minutes more until golden brown.
6. Prepare glaze - Prepare glaze by mixing powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, and salt until smooth.
7. Cool and glaze - Cool muffins completely. Microwave glaze 30 seconds to thin, then spoon over each muffin. Top with walnuts if desired.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/carrot-cake-muffins/)

meals.name: Cinnamon Roll Muffins
meals.instructions:
## Cinnamon Roll Muffins

1. Mix dough - Combine 2 cups flour, yeast, salt, and sugar. Mix together.
2. Add wet ingredients - Warm milk and butter in microwave for 30 seconds. Add egg, milk, and butter to flour mixture.
3. Beat dough - Beat on low speed, gradually increasing to high for 2 minutes until combined.
4. Knead - Add remaining flour gradually until dough pulls away from bowl. Knead 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
5. Rise - Transfer to oiled bowl, cover, and rise 1 hour until doubled.
6. Make filling - Mix filling ingredients (butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt) separately.
7. Roll and fill - Roll dough into 18x12 inch rectangle. Spread butter and sprinkle cinnamon mixture over it.
8. Shape rolls - Roll tightly from long end and pinch edges closed.
9. Cut and place - Cut into 12 pieces using floss or sharp knife. Place in buttered muffin tin.
10. Second rise - Cover and rise 1 hour until doubled and puffy.
11. Bake - Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes until golden brown.
12. Prepare glaze - Prepare glaze by microwaving cream cheese 15-30 seconds, then mixing with powdered sugar, milk, salt, and vanilla.
13. Glaze and serve - Spoon glaze over cooled rolls and serve warm.

[Original Recipe](https://bromabakery.com/cinnamon-roll-muffins/)
